page.title: 11EDUCATION.St.Georges C.of E.
page.content: St.George's school was built in 1970,then it had seven classes,six of which were being used.Atthat time 200 pupils attended the school.They mainly came from the Council Estate. The numbers have slowly decreased, now there are only ninety pupils left. This is because many young families moved into the area when the Estate was first built.Now these children have grown up and few new families have moved into the area.Until recently the school was named after the village. The school at Wrotham is now called St.George's because there is another school in the area called Wrotham School.This meant that the two schools got there post mixed up.The Primary school changed its name two years ago.
